snp1.8:1.2: Reading the absolutive in an infinitive sense, per commentery: _abhisamecca viharitukāmena_.
snp1.8:5.3: For “have become or will be” (_bhūtā va sambhavesī va_) I follow Norman and Bodhi in reading _sambhavesī_ as a future active participle. Compare such Sanskrit constructions as Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 2.3.1.24: _bhūtaṁ caiva bhaviṣyacca jātaṁ ca janiṣyamāṇaṁ_ (“has become and will be, born and to be born”).
snp1.8:10.4: Note that _jātu_ here is not connected to _jāti_ “birth”. Rather, _na hi jātu_ is an idiom meaning “never”. Commentary: _ekaṃseneva_.
